poem:
### A Heart of Drones

Beyond borders, the heart falters  
in the silent counsel of mornings,  
a leader wades, heavy with knowing,  
while the sky cracks with spirits unseen.  
In Denmark's tremor, devices hum  
against the cornered echo of authority—  
grey wings span, a dialogue of whispers  
stretches over restless ground.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
